arm_group.description: 32 subjects in the study will receive biceps tenodesis as a surgical intervention
32 subjects in the study will receive biceps tenotomy as a surgical intervention

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to determine what the different outcomes are for biceps
      tenodesis and tenotomy in the treatment of the long head of the biceps pathology.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Outcomes Between Biceps Tenotomy and Tenodesis in the Treatment of the Long Head of the Biceps Pathology

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patient with chronic refractive bicipital pain

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

intervention.description: A biceps tenotomy procedure involves cutting of the long head of the biceps just prior to its insertion on the superior labrum of  the glenoid.
Biceps tenodesis involves detaching the long head of the biceps from it's superior labrum in the shoulder and reattaching it to the humerus bone just below the shoulder.

clinical_study.official_title: Biceps Tenotomy or Tenodesis in Treating Long Head of the Biceps Pathology: a Prospective Randomized Controlled Trial

primary_outcome.description: The scale measures pain from 0 to 10 and also includes a questionnaire for assessing the activity of daily living.
primary_outcome.measure: American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeons (ASES) Shoulder Score

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The questionnaire measures mobility, ability to care for self, ability to perform usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
